segment.source: IT professionals can review information about event IDs in Windows Defender for Windows 10 and see any relevant action they can take.
segment.target: IT professionals can review information about event IDs in Windows Defender for Windows 10 and see any relevant action they can take.

segment.source: IT professionals can review information about event IDs in Windows Defender for Windows 10 and see any relevant action they can take.
segment.target: IT professionals can review information about event IDs in Windows Defender for Windows 10 and see any relevant action they can take.

segment.source: This section provides the following information about Windows Defender client events:
segment.target: This section provides the following information about Windows Defender client events:

segment.source: The text of the message as it appears in the event
segment.target: The text of the message as it appears in the event

segment.source: The name of the source of the message
segment.target: The name of the source of the message

segment.source: The symbolic name that identifies each message in the programming source code
segment.target: The symbolic name that identifies each message in the programming source code

segment.source: Use the information in this table to help troubleshoot Windows Defender client events; these are located in the Windows Event Viewer, under Windows Logs.
segment.target: Use the information in this table to help troubleshoot Windows Defender client events; these are located in the Windows Event Viewer, under Windows Logs.

segment.source: To view a Windows Defender client event
segment.target: To view a Windows Defender client event

segment.source: In the console tree, expand Applications and Services Logs, then Microsoft, then Windows, then Windows Defender.
segment.target: In the console tree, expand Applications and Services Logs, then Microsoft, then Windows, then Windows Defender.

segment.source: In the details pane, view the list of individual events to find your event.
segment.target: In the details pane, view the list of individual events to find your event.

segment.source: Click the event to see specific details about an event in the lower pane, under the General and Details tabs.
segment.target: Click the event to see specific details about an event in the lower pane, under the General and Details tabs.

segment.source: You can find a complete list of the Microsoft antimalware event IDs, the symbol, and the description of each ID in Windows Server Antimalware Events TechNet.
segment.target: You can find a complete list of the Microsoft antimalware event IDs, the symbol, and the description of each ID in Windows Server Antimalware Events TechNet.

segment.target: Scan Resources: Resources (such as files/directories/BHO) that were scanned.User: Domainlt;User

segment.source: Standard HRESULT values.Error Description: Error descriptionDescription of the error.
segment.target: Standard HRESULT values.Error Description: Error descriptionDescription of the error.

segment.source: The Windows Defender client encountered an error, and the current scan has stopped.
segment.target: The Windows Defender client encountered an error, and the current scan has stopped.

segment.source: The scan might fail due to a client-side issue.
segment.target: The scan might fail due to a client-side issue.

segment.source: This event record includes the scan ID, type of scan (antivirus, antispyware, antimalware), scan parameters, the user that started the scan, the error code, and a description of the error.
segment.target: This event record includes the scan ID, type of scan (antivirus, antispyware, antimalware), scan parameters, the user that started the scan, the error code, and a description of the error.

segment.source: If it fails in the same way, go to the Microsoft Support site, enter the error number in the Search box to look for the error code.
segment.target: If it fails in the same way, go to the Microsoft Support site, enter the error number in the Search box to look for the error code.

segment.source: The antimalware engine found malware or other potentially unwanted software.

segment.source: The antimalware platform deleted history of malware and other potentially unwanted software.
segment.target: The antimalware platform deleted history of malware and other potentially unwanted software.

segment.source: Windows Defender has removed history of malware and other potentially unwanted software.
segment.target: Windows Defender has removed history of malware and other potentially unwanted software.

segment.source: Time: The time when the event occurred, for example when the history is purged.
segment.target: Time: The time when the event occurred, for example when the history is purged.

segment.source: Note that this parameter is not used in threat events so that there is no confusion regarding whether it is remediation time or infection time.
segment.target: Note that this parameter is not used in threat events so that there is no confusion regarding whether it is remediation time or infection time.

segment.source: For those, we specifically call them as Action Time or Detection Time.User: Domainlt;User

segment.source: Windows Defender can suspend and take routine action on this threat.

segment.source: The Windows Defender client encountered this error due to critical issues.

segment.source: Review the error description then follow the relevant User action steps below.

segment.source: Update the definitions then verify that the removal was successful.

segment.target: Verify that the user has permission to access the necessary resources.

segment.source: This error occurs when there is a problem updating definitions.
segment.target: This error occurs when there is a problem updating definitions.

segment.source: Click the Update definitions button on the Update tab in Windows Defender.
segment.target: Click the Update definitions button on the Update tab in Windows Defender.

segment.source: Download the latest definitions from the Microsoft Malware Protection Center.
segment.target: Download the latest definitions from the Microsoft Malware Protection Center.

segment.source: Note: The size of the definitions file downloaded from the Microsoft Malware Protection Center can exceed 60 MB and should not be used as a long-term solution for updating definitions.
segment.target: Note: The size of the definitions file downloaded from the Microsoft Malware Protection Center can exceed 60 MB and should not be used as a long-term solution for updating definitions.

segment.source: Review the entries in the %Windir%\WindowsUpdate.log file for more information about this error.
segment.target: Review the entries in the %Windir%\WindowsUpdate.log file for more information about this error.

segment.source: Antimalware support for this operating system version will soon end.
segment.target: Antimalware support for this operating system version will soon end.

segment.source: The support for your operating system will expire shortly.
segment.target: The support for your operating system will expire shortly.

segment.source: Running Windows Defender on an out of support operating system is not an adequate solution to protect against threats.
segment.target: Running Windows Defender on an out of support operating system is not an adequate solution to protect against threats.

segment.source: Antimalware support for this operating system has ended.
segment.target: Antimalware support for this operating system has ended.

segment.source: You must upgrade the operating system for continued support.
segment.target: You must upgrade the operating system for continued support.

segment.source: The support for your operating system has expired.
segment.target: The support for your operating system has expired.

segment.source: Running Windows Defender on an out of support operating system is not an adequate solution to protect against threats.
segment.target: Running Windows Defender on an out of support operating system is not an adequate solution to protect against threats.

segment.source: The antimalware engine no longer supports this operating system, and is no longer protecting your system from malware.
segment.target: The antimalware engine no longer supports this operating system, and is no longer protecting your system from malware.

segment.source: The support for your operating system has expired.
segment.target: The support for your operating system has expired.

segment.source: Windows Defender is no longer supported on your operating system, has stopped functioning, and is not protecting against malware threats.
segment.target: Windows Defender is no longer supported on your operating system, has stopped functioning, and is not protecting against malware threats.

segment.source: Real-time protection encountered an error and failed.
segment.target: Real-time protection encountered an error and failed.

segment.source: Windows Defender Real-Time Protection feature has encountered an error and failed.
segment.target: Windows Defender Real-Time Protection feature has encountered an error and failed.

segment.source: Internet Explorer downloads and Microsoft Outlook Express attachments
segment.target: Internet Explorer downloads and Microsoft Outlook Express attachments

segment.source: Error Code: Error codeResult code associated with threat status.
segment.target: Error Code: Error codeResult code associated with threat status.

segment.source: Standard HRESULT values.Error Description: Error descriptionDescription of the error.
segment.target: Standard HRESULT values.Error Description: Error descriptionDescription of the error.

segment.source: Reason: The reason Windows Defender real-time protection has restarted a feature.
segment.target: Reason: The reason Windows Defender real-time protection has restarted a feature.

segment.source: You should restart the system then run a full scan because it’s possible the system was not protected for some time.
segment.target: You should restart the system then run a full scan because it’s possible the system was not protected for some time.

segment.source: The Windows Defender client’s real-time protection feature encountered an error because one of the services failed to start.
segment.target: The Windows Defender client’s real-time protection feature encountered an error because one of the services failed to start.

segment.source: If it is followed by a 3007 event ID, the failure was temporary and the antimalware client recovered from the failure.
segment.target: If it is followed by a 3007 event ID, the failure was temporary and the antimalware client recovered from the failure.

segment.source: Real-time protection recovered from a failure.
segment.target: Real-time protection recovered from a failure.

segment.source: We recommend running a full system scan when you see this error.
segment.target: We recommend running a full system scan when you see this error.

segment.source: Windows Defender Real-time Protection has restarted a feature.
segment.target: Windows Defender Real-time Protection has restarted a feature.

segment.source: It is recommended that you run a full system scan to detect any items that may have been missed while this agent was down.
segment.target: It is recommended that you run a full system scan to detect any items that may have been missed while this agent was down.

segment.source: IE downloads and Outlook Express attachments
segment.target: IE downloads and Outlook Express attachments

segment.source: Reason: The reason Windows Defender real-time protection has restarted a feature.
segment.target: Reason: The reason Windows Defender real-time protection has restarted a feature.

segment.source: The real-time protection feature has restarted.
segment.target: The real-time protection feature has restarted.

segment.source: If this event happens again, contact Microsoft Technical Support.
segment.target: If this event happens again, contact Microsoft Technical Support.

segment.source: Windows Defender Real-time Protection scanning for malware and other potentially unwanted software was enabled.
segment.target: Windows Defender Real-time Protection scanning for malware and other potentially unwanted software was enabled.

segment.source: Windows Defender Real-time Protection scanning for malware and other potentially unwanted software was disabled.
segment.target: Windows Defender Real-time Protection scanning for malware and other potentially unwanted software was disabled.

segment.source: Windows Defender Real-time Protection feature configuration has changed.
segment.target: Windows Defender Real-time Protection feature configuration has changed.

segment.source: IE downloads and Outlook Express attachments
segment.target: IE downloads and Outlook Express attachments

segment.source: If this is an unexpected event you should review the settings as this may be the result of malware.
segment.target: If this is an unexpected event you should review the settings as this may be the result of malware.

segment.source: Old value: Old value numberOld Windows Defender configuration value.New value: New value numberNew Windows Defender configuration value.
segment.target: Old value: Old value numberOld Windows Defender configuration value.New value: New value numberNew Windows Defender configuration value.

segment.source: The antimalware engine encountered an error and failed.
segment.target: The antimalware engine encountered an error and failed.

segment.source: Windows Defender engine has been terminated due to an unexpected error.
segment.target: Windows Defender engine has been terminated due to an unexpected error.

segment.source: Failure Type: Failure type, for example: Crash or HangException Code: Error codeResource: Resource
segment.target: Failure Type: Failure type, for example: Crash or HangException Code: Error codeResource: Resource

segment.source: For antimalware, antivirus and spyware, at an elevated command prompt, type net stop msmpsvc, and then type net start msmpsvc to restart the antimalware engine.
segment.target: For antimalware, antivirus and spyware, at an elevated command prompt, type net stop msmpsvc, and then type net start msmpsvc to restart the antimalware engine.

segment.source: For the Network Inspection System, at an elevated command prompt, type net start nissrv, and then type net start nissrv to restart the Network Inspection System engine by using the NiSSRV.exe file.
segment.target: For the Network Inspection System, at an elevated command prompt, type net start nissrv, and then type net start nissrv to restart the Network Inspection System engine by using the NiSSRV.exe file.

segment.source: If it fails in the same way, look up the error code by accessing the Microsoft Support Site and entering the error number in the Search box, and contact Microsoft Technical Support.
segment.target: If it fails in the same way, look up the error code by accessing the Microsoft Support Site and entering the error number in the Search box, and contact Microsoft Technical Support.

segment.source: The Windows Defender client engine stopped due to an unexpected error.
segment.target: The Windows Defender client engine stopped due to an unexpected error.

segment.source: If it fails in the same way, go to the Microsoft Support site, enter the error number in the Search box to look for the error code.
segment.target: If it fails in the same way, go to the Microsoft Support site, enter the error number in the Search box to look for the error code.

segment.source: Scanning for malware and other potentially unwanted software is enabled.
segment.target: Scanning for malware and other potentially unwanted software is enabled.

segment.source: Windows Defender scanning for malware and other potentially unwanted software has been enabled.
segment.target: Windows Defender scanning for malware and other potentially unwanted software has been enabled.

segment.source: Scanning for malware and other potentially unwanted software is disabled.
segment.target: Scanning for malware and other potentially unwanted software is disabled.

segment.source: Windows Defender scanning for malware and other potentially unwanted software is disabled.
segment.target: Windows Defender scanning for malware and other potentially unwanted software is disabled.

segment.source: Windows Defender scanning for viruses has been enabled.
segment.target: Windows Defender scanning for viruses has been enabled.

segment.source: Windows Defender scanning for viruses is disabled.
segment.target: Windows Defender scanning for viruses is disabled.

segment.source: The antimalware platform will expire soon.
segment.target: The antimalware platform will expire soon.

segment.source: Windows Defender has entered a grace period and will soon expire.
segment.target: Windows Defender has entered a grace period and will soon expire.

segment.source: After expiration, this program will disable protection against viruses, spyware, and other potentially unwanted software.
segment.target: After expiration, this program will disable protection against viruses, spyware, and other potentially unwanted software.

segment.source: Expiration Reason: The reason Windows Defender will expire.Expiration Date: The date Windows Defender will expire.
segment.target: Expiration Reason: The reason Windows Defender will expire.Expiration Date: The date Windows Defender will expire.

segment.source: Windows Defender grace period has expired.
segment.target: Windows Defender grace period has expired.

segment.source: Protection against viruses, spyware, and other potentially unwanted software is disabled.
segment.target: Protection against viruses, spyware, and other potentially unwanted software is disabled.

segment.source: Expiration Reason:Expiration Date: Error Code: Error codeResult code associated with threat status.

segment.source: Standard HRESULT values.Error Description: Error descriptionDescription of the error.
segment.target: Standard HRESULT values.Error Description: Error descriptionDescription of the error.

segment.source: Windows Defender client error codes If Windows Defender experiences any issues it will usually give you an error code to help you troubleshoot the issue.
segment.target: Windows Defender client error codes If Windows Defender experiences any issues it will usually give you an error code to help you troubleshoot the issue.

segment.source: Most often an error means there was a problem installing an update.
segment.target: Most often an error means there was a problem installing an update.

segment.source: This section provides the following information about Windows Defender client errors.
segment.target: This section provides the following information about Windows Defender client errors.

segment.source: - The error code - The possible reason for the error - Advice on what to do now Use the information in these tables to help troubleshoot Windows Defender error codes.
segment.target: - The error code - The possible reason for the error - Advice on what to do now Use the information in these tables to help troubleshoot Windows Defender error codes.

segment.source: This error indicates that you might have run out of memory.
segment.target: This error indicates that you might have run out of memory.

segment.source: Check the available memory on your device.
segment.target: Check the available memory on your device.

segment.source: Close any unused applications that are running to free up memory on your device.
segment.target: Close any unused applications that are running to free up memory on your device.

segment.source: Restart the device and run the scan again.
segment.target: Restart the device and run the scan again.

segment.source: This error indicates that there might be a problem with your security product.
segment.target: This error indicates that there might be a problem with your security product.

segment.source: Click the Update definitions button on the Update tab in Windows Defender.
segment.target: Click the Update definitions button on the Update tab in Windows Defender.

segment.source: Download the latest definitions from the Microsoft Malware Protection Center.
segment.target: Download the latest definitions from the Microsoft Malware Protection Center.

segment.source: Note: The size of the definitions file downloaded from the Microsoft Malware Protection Center can exceed 60 MB and should not be used as a long-term solution for updating definitions.
segment.target: Note: The size of the definitions file downloaded from the Microsoft Malware Protection Center can exceed 60 MB and should not be used as a long-term solution for updating definitions.

segment.source: Restart the device and try again.
segment.target: Restart the device and try again.

segment.source: This error indicates that there might be an engine configuration error; commonly, this is related to input data that does not allow the engine to function properly.
segment.target: This error indicates that there might be an engine configuration error; commonly, this is related to input data that does not allow the engine to function properly.

segment.source: This error indicates that Windows Defender failed to quarantine a threat.
segment.target: This error indicates that Windows Defender failed to quarantine a threat.

segment.source: This error indicates that a reboot is required to complete threat removal.
segment.target: This error indicates that a reboot is required to complete threat removal.

segment.source: This error indicates that the threat might no longer be present on the media, or malware might be stopping you from scanning your device.
segment.target: This error indicates that the threat might no longer be present on the media, or malware might be stopping you from scanning your device.

segment.source: Run the Microsoft Safety Scanner then update your security software and try again.
segment.target: Run the Microsoft Safety Scanner then update your security software and try again.

segment.source: This error indicates that a full system scan might be required.
segment.target: This error indicates that a full system scan might be required.

segment.source: This error indicates that manual steps are required to complete threat removal.
segment.target: This error indicates that manual steps are required to complete threat removal.

segment.source: Follow the manual remediation steps outlined in the Microsoft Malware Protection Encyclopedia.
segment.target: Follow the manual remediation steps outlined in the Microsoft Malware Protection Encyclopedia.

segment.source: You can find a threat-specific link in the event history.
segment.target: You can find a threat-specific link in the event history.

segment.source: This error indicates that removal inside the container type might not be not supported.
segment.target: This error indicates that removal inside the container type might not be not supported.

segment.source: Windows Defender is not able to remediate threats detected inside the archive.
segment.target: Windows Defender is not able to remediate threats detected inside the archive.

segment.source: Consider manually removing the detected resources.
segment.target: Consider manually removing the detected resources.

segment.source: This error indicates that removal of low and medium threats might be disabled.
segment.target: This error indicates that removal of low and medium threats might be disabled.

segment.source: Check the detected threats and resolve them as required.
segment.target: Check the detected threats and resolve them as required.

segment.source: This error indicates a rescan of the threat is required.
segment.target: This error indicates a rescan of the threat is required.

segment.source: This error indicates that an offline scan is required.
segment.target: This error indicates that an offline scan is required.

segment.source: You can read about how to do this in the Windows Defender Offline article.
segment.target: You can read about how to do this in the Windows Defender Offline article.

segment.source: This error indicates that Windows Defender does not support the current version of the platform and requires a new version of the platform.
segment.target: This error indicates that Windows Defender does not support the current version of the platform and requires a new version of the platform.

segment.source: You can only use Windows Defender in Windows 10.
segment.target: You can only use Windows Defender in Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8, Windows 7 and Windows Vista, you can use System Center Endpoint Protection.
segment.target: For Windows 8, Windows 7 and Windows Vista, you can use System Center Endpoint Protection.

segment.source: Check your Internet connection, then run the scan again.
segment.target: Check your Internet connection, then run the scan again.

segment.source: Check your Internet connection, then run the scan again.
segment.target: Check your Internet connection, then run the scan again.

segment.source: The cause is not clearly defined.
segment.target: The cause is not clearly defined.

segment.source: Click the Update definitions button on the Update tab in Windows Defender.
segment.target: Click the Update definitions button on the Update tab in Windows Defender.

segment.source: Download the latest definitions from the Microsoft Malware Protection Center.
segment.target: Download the latest definitions from the Microsoft Malware Protection Center.

segment.source: Note: The size of the definitions file downloaded from the Microsoft Malware Protection Center can exceed 60 MB and should not be used as a long-term solution for updating definitions.
segment.target: Note: The size of the definitions file downloaded from the Microsoft Malware Protection Center can exceed 60 MB and should not be used as a long-term solution for updating definitions.

segment.source: Restart the device and try again.
segment.target: Restart the device and try again.

segment.source: It might be triggered when malware removal is not successful.
segment.target: It might be triggered when malware removal is not successful.

segment.source: It might have triggered when a scan fails to complete.
segment.target: It might have triggered when a scan fails to complete.

segment.source: Update and manage Windows Defender in Windows 10
segment.target: Update and manage Windows Defender in Windows 10
